channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Right filter lane vehicle detection, 20th April
item.description:
The right filter lane isn't detecting vehicles waiting to turn right into Old Cheltenham Rd. You can sit there waiting with no other vehicles approaching the junction in any other direction for what feels like a long time.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 198 Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two potholes, 20th April
item.description:
These potholes have been here more than four months
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 45 Linden Avenue, Cheltenham

item.title: Unauthorised Camping, 20th April
item.description:
In the Gloucester City owned field behind the Scout Hut in Hucclecote, there looks to be someone camping + litter

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 62 Larkhay Road, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes here and there in Tobyfield Road, 20th April
item.description:
There are potholes along this part of Tobyfield Road that need repairing. As I said before they are everywhere. It is a disgrace when so much revenue must be taken for road tax with all of the cars on the roads today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 11 Tobyfield Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes all along Kayte Lane, 20th April
item.description:
There are potholes all along Kayte Lane that need fixing. When driving through Bishops Cleeve one zig zags across the road to try and avoid them all and not damage the wheels or suspension of the car.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 53 Kayte Lane, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road breaking up plus potholes, 20th April
item.description:
The edge of the road is breaking up by the pavement near the Swallow. It is a huge channel along the edge of the pavement, apart from the potholes. The roads in Bishops Cleeve are shocking with potholes everywhere
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 84 Bishops Drive, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Box of rubbish dumped, 20th April
item.description:
Someone's dumped a box of rubbish on the right hand side of the Yeend Close, going towards the Tewkesbury Road. It's opposite the cut through to the middle car park on Coppice Gate.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 155 River Leys, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 42 Kayte Lane, Cheltenham

item.title: Deep pothole widening in a second which will soon become a crater, 18th April
item.description:
Pothole reopened following the last council bodged repair in January. Incredibly the crater next to it has recently been marked for repair but the one just a meter away totally ignored It clearly exceeds the threshold for urgent repair and is baffling why it wouldn't be fixed at the sane time as the council repair team are standing just a meter away with all the repair supplies. The whole section needs properly cutting out and resurfacing - not another badly executed dog turd fix by Bodgeit, Bashit and Scarper; the councils executive repair team

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 22 Whittington Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
